column7: A firm's long-run value ultimately depends on its business fundamentals. This course covers micro- and macro-economic drivers of such fundamentals, such as consumer demand, market competitiveness, government regulation, interest rates, business cycles, and monetary policy. Also includes topics in risk and intertemporal decision-making. 2 or 4 graduate hours. No professional credit.
column9: 2 or 4 graduate hours. No professional credit.
column11: May be offered as an 8-week course.
